jobs.title: Software Engineer (Front End)
jobs.location: Central Singapore Community Development Council, Singapore
jobs.about_us: HeveaConnect is a digital marketplace for sustainably processed natural rubber. It serves the natural rubber market with an exclusive platform for farmers, producers, consumers as well as facilitators such as financial institutions, logistics and warehousing suppliers. Through HeveaConnect, natural rubber producers and consumers are able to track pricing, have access to market information and transact directly on the platform. Other offerings provided include value-added services such as financing, insurance and logistics. We're looking for a collaborative Software Engineer to help us deliver our vision of a secure marketplace for natural rubber and other software products for the natural rubber supply chain. You'll enjoy this role if you like the opportunities and challenges of working in a growing business and building extensible, secure and performant systems using best practices across different devices such as web, mobile and IOT and different technologies. You will play a genuinely impactful part that makes a difference to our customers and the industry on our path towards sustainability and traceability. You'll collaborate daily with engineering, product and commercial colleagues and help to build an effective and creative working culture. Our current tech stack includes, but it is not limited to: Python 3; JavaScript; TypeScript; C#; Apex; PHP; Kotlin; Swift; Ionic; Django; Laravel; .NET Framework; MSSQL; PostgreSQL.
jobs.job_description: Responsibilities: Deliver production quality code for front-end and mobile applications using HTML, CCS, JavaScript and TypeScript. Knowledge of a front-end framework such as Angular, React or Vue is preferred. Knowledge of cross platform mobile development is a plus. Design, develop, deploy, maintain and improve with a test driven approach HeveaConnect software and visualizations Work with business stakeholders, product owners and business analysts to analyse requirements, develop ideas and design solutions Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
jobs.job_requirements: Requirements: Master's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or equivalent At least 2 years of commercial experience in front-end development Interest in digital trading platform Strong knowledge of one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, C#, Java, Swift, Kotlin, C/C++ A strong understanding of in object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms, UI/UX and web applications A passion for computer programming and a deep curiosity to learn and absorb new technologies quickly Strong communication skills to advocate your ideas in a clear and concise manner to the team.

jobs.title: Quantum Scientist / Engineer
jobs.about_us: DSO National Laboratories (DSO) is Singapore's largest defence research and development (R&D) organisation, with the critical mission to develop technological solutions to sharpen the cutting edge of Singapore's national security. At DSO, you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace. The Emerging Systems Division focuses research and development on a broad spectrum of capabilities that are critical to the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) defence systems. These include antenna design and electromagnetics, as well as next-wave technologies in the areas of lasers and advanced materials. The successful candidate will be part of a team of research scientists and engineers developing quantum capabilities in DSO. The goal is to translate cutting-edge, quantum sensing technologies into robust solutions for defence applications. At the Applied Physical Science Lab in DSO, the successful candidate will work alongside highly motivated colleagues, collaborate with both local and overseas quantum communities to unlock the power of quantum technologies. People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework, we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities.
jobs.job_description:
In this role, you will:
- Design and develop robust quantum sensors for inertial or electromagnetic sensing
- Test and characterise quantum gases or devices in high vacuum, cryogenic setups
- Analyse experimental data from atom interferometry or electromagnetic sensing measurements
- Survey and evaluate the feasibility of emerging quantum sensing technologies
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- PhD / Masters / Bachelor’s Degree in Applied Physics / Engineering Physics / Physics
- Experience in high vacuum and cryogenic experiments
- Working proficiency in a programming language (Python, MATLAB)
- Strong background in quantum physics
- Independent and self-driven learner
- Works well in a team
- Passion to translate lab technologies into real world applications

jobs.title: E&I Site Engineer
jobs.job_description:
Must know how to handle Client and Electrical sub-con
Must know how to coordinate with other discipline not only Electrical team.
Must have experience in E-House fabrication works.
Knowledgeable in Cable Tray/Ladder installation, Lighting and HVAC/F&G devices.
Manage to work independently.
Familiar with some Testing for Lighting , hvac and f&g.
Familiar with material withdrawal in warehouse and MTO if necessary.
Ensuring safety, compliance, and quality, while also managing projects,
Monitor project progress, making necessary adjustments to ensure projects stay on track.
Supervise electricians, providing guidance and direction as needed.
Ensure that all electrical systems and equipment meet industry regulations and standards.
Conduct risk assessments to identify and mitigate potential hazards.
Ensure the quality of electrical work by inspecting and assessing the work done by the electrical staff.
jobs.job_requirements:
Min. Diploma in Electrical Engineering / Electrical & Electronics Engineering / Control and Instrumentation or related fields.
Min. 3 years’ experience in water and wastewater treatment projects.
Know-how of basic electrical starters and VFD design knowledge.
Know-how of electrical cable sizing, voltage drop, cable gland sizing and cable schedule.
Know-how of overcurrent protection device sizing and selection.
Know-how of electrical equipment and instruments installation.
Good skills in E&I troubleshooting.
Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
General computer knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Outlook.
Good team player.
Can work with others harmoniously.
Willing to learn new activities.
Willing to travel overseas at short notice.

jobs.title: Senior Environmental Consultant
jobs.about_us: Our People & Places Solutions business - reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do - the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology - we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow. Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed - today and into tomorrow.
jobs.job_description: When it comes to environmental consulting, we see the world as our greatest resource. That’s why clients trust Jacobs to help solve their most complex environmental challenges and opportunities. We partner with government agencies, municipalities, private sector companies and leading environmental organisations to safely clean-up legacy liabilities for redevelopment, and deliver proven industry expertise on new infrastructure, sustainability and environmental health and safety initiatives around the globe. Bring your creativity, collaborative spirit and extreme attention to detail, and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you - so we can deliver extraordinary solutions for a better tomorrow, together. Our Asia Environmental Solutions is currently seeking a Senior Environmental Consultant to join our team in Singapore. The main duties Independently manage construction phase Environmental Management and Monitoring Plan (EMMP) for major infrastructure projects. Conduct site inspection to identify environmental issues and noncompliances. Provide recommendations to improve the site's environmental performance. Liaise with client and contractors on implementing the recommended measures, correction measures Prepare and/or review technical report of the EMMP projects in Singapore Presenting the technical reports to the client and local Government agencies. Liaise with client and Local Authorities on the acceptance of the EMMP report. Provide technical inputs to a team of environmental engineers for EIA/EMMP projects.
jobs.job_requirements: Here’s What You’ll Need To be a successful candidate you shall possess Bachelor or Master's Degree in Environment or related engineering/science discipline Registered Environmental Control Officer Minimum 8 years of experience in managing construction phase EMMP preferred due to the nature of work Strong communication skills and ability to guide a team of technical professionals to complete the tasks Good presentation skills and strong report writing skills Good interpersonal skills as lead consultant liaising with contractors, clients and local Authorities and Project Stakeholders Singapore local experience and familiar with Singapore legal and authorities’ requirements for environmental impact assessments, environmental management and monitoring planning and Pollution Control requirements Proficiency in using GIS software will be an added advantage.

jobs.title: Research Managers/ Senior Research Managers
jobs.about_us: You can expect to be joining a dynamic and creative agency. You will be involved in researching some of the world’s leading brands across a range of sectors. You will handle multiple accounts independently from start to finish, ensuring that the clients’ business issues and information needs are effectively met through well-executed research. In this position, you will be responsible in producing outstanding results in all aspects of market research including problem definition, design, vendor and client management, data collection, data analysis, report writing and presentations. You will help mentor more junior staff and will support the more senior team with client growth and new business pitches. As a highly motivated individual, you should enjoy innovating and thinking creatively. Successful candidates can expect a challenging environment and career development that includes domestic and international assignments and overseas posting opportunities.
jobs.job_description: You will be involved in researching some of the world’s leading brands across a range of sectors. You will handle multiple accounts independently from start to finish, ensuring that the clients’ business issues and information needs are effectively met through well-executed research. In this position, you will be responsible in producing outstanding results in all aspects of market research including problem definition, design, vendor and client management, data collection, data analysis, report writing and presentations. You will help mentor more junior staff and will support the more senior team with client growth and new business pitches. As a highly motivated individual, you should enjoy innovating and thinking creatively. Successful candidates can expect a challenging environment and career development that includes domestic and international assignments and overseas posting opportunities.

As a highly motivated individual, you should enjoy innovating and thinking creatively. Successful candidates can expect a challenging environment and career development that includes domestic and international assignments and overseas posting opportunities.

jobs.title: Laboratory Officer (Scientific Infrastructure & Analytics), ISCE2
jobs.job_description:
ISCE2 is looking for a highly motivated candidate with great interpersonal skills to join Lab and Facilities Division. The successful candidate is expected to contribute to ISCE2 by the following:
- Upkeep and ensure good lab housekeeping for designated laboratories, sufficient supplies of common chemical and laboratory consumables (including procurement) etc.
- Lab ambassadors to promote sustainable lab operations and greening of laboratories.
- Ensure common equipment functionality and its operation within required limits by internal and external preventive maintenance.
- Initiation and coordinate disposal of unwanted, obsolete chemicals and generated waste in designated laboratory.
- Ensure all new laboratory personnel receive laboratory induction and specific lab operational procedures before they commence work in the lab.
- Ensure lab occupants (i.e., staff and students) comply with general laboratory safety rules.
- Communicates information on identified hazards and precautions to all lab users.
- Initiate and coordinate all necessary corrective actions to rectify safety discrepancy found in the lab.
- Maintain up-to-date chemical inventory and ensure Safety Datasheet (SDS) for chemicals are readily available for respective laboratories.
- Coordinate the compilation and maintain laboratory documentation (equipment manuals, equipment standard operating procedures, maintenance records and inventory record of regulated chemicals).
jobs.job_requirements:
JOB REQUIREMENT
- Polytechnic diploma related to chemical engineering or equivalent.
- Prior work in a laboratory is not a requirement but an added advantage
- At least 4 years of experience
- Team player with initiative, drive and good communication skills.
- Ability to work independently under minimal supervision
- This position would require the successful candidate to work at different sites including the main site at Jurong Island (shuttle buses are available at various locations for commute into and out of Jurong Island site)
- The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

jobs.title: Senior Lead Research Scientist in Digital Twins and Industrial Digitalization
jobs.about_us: FM is a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses, providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles. Industrial Automation, digitalization, and cyber security are identified areas with increasing challenges and risks in all Industries in the next decades. To provide the best-in-class actionable science-based loss preparedness and prevention solutions to businesses, FM is making vast investments into this area over the coming years, starting with the creation of the dedicated global Research Center for Automation, Digitalization, and Cyber Security headquartered in Luxembourg.
jobs.job_description: You will be part of the Industrial Digitalization Research Team within FM’s Research Division, that consists of scientists studying industrial automation, digitalization, digital twins, and cyber security. It is headquartered in EMEA (Luxembourg) with additional locations in the U.S. (Norwood, Massachusetts), and (possibly in the future) in Asia (Singapore). In following with the organizational strategy to build up and center the Industrial Digitalization and Automation Research activities in Luxembourg, this position will have a strong coordinative and organizational responsibilities of activities over fundamental and applied research activities performed across the globe. The goal of the group is to assess and reduce industrial risk as a result of increased digitalization of infrastructure and processes, by staying abreast of state-of-the-art implementations, developments, and roll-out of Digital Twin technologies and concepts, partnering with the world’s top Industrial Digitalization scientists and researchers, and building on the practical experience from over 1300 engineers that perform over 100,000 site-specific risk assessments each year. While the research is similar in technical rigor to that conducted at universities and in top government and industrial laboratories, the results are used to protect mutual client owner businesses via site-specific engineering, underwriting, product certification, claims, sales, and other organizations within the FM Group. Role You will be responsible for identifying, planning, coordinating, and conducting research related projects to the increasingly widespread use of digital twin technologies and solutions in industrial applications. In particular, the associated risks of physical damage to Operational Technology (OT) equipment and/or stock in process resulting from the use of digital twin applications, as well as scientifically proven protection solutions to help mitigate such risks are the focus of this position. Perform fundamental and applied research to understand the applications, assess property damage risks, relating to digital twin implementations in different industrial applications. Develop industrial digitalization risk scenarios and innovative mitigation strategies related with increasing Industrial digitalization (e.g. Industry 4.0, digital twins, AI in industrial applications). Conduct strategic industrial digitalization projects from scope to implementation, make use of most appropriate methods, technologies, and models. Coordinate your activities with internal stakeholders, guiding internal and external research experts, and manage relationships with academic institutes and standardization bodies. Actively drive forward Industrial Digitalization risk evaluation knowhow through attendance and participation in conferences/industry events/renowned Industrial digitalization scientific journals.
jobs.job_requirements: Qualified Candidates Must Have: Demonstrated project, research, and team management abilities. The job title and level may be adjusted depending on qualifications and experience. A PhD in Engineering, Computer Science or field related to Digital twin technologies. An MSc with appropriate industrial research experience in industrial automation, process engineering, or a similar role also accepted. Proven track record in successfully implementing digitalization projects in industrial settings or implementation of IT projects in corporate environments. Strong knowledge of industrial control systems, IoT technologies, cloud and edge computing, data analytics and digital twin concepts as well as exposure to cybersecurity principles and best practices. Familiarity with industry standards and regulations related to digital twin design and application. An extensive personal network of experts in academia, research, or governmental agencies in industry consortia defining digital twin technologies and concepts.

jobs.title: Market Research Data Analyst
jobs.location: Central Singapore Community Development Council, Singapore
jobs.about_us: Agility Research & Strategy is currently looking for a dynamic candidate to fill this position. Our team is a diverse group of talented individuals that come from a range of backgrounds, Our DNA is agile, intelligent, self-starters who are keen to grow and learn. Working with the C suite of the world's leading Premium and Luxury brands, this role gives the right individual an opportunity to help these brands with our proven methodologies and solutions. We are looking for a data and research analyst who is able to translate data into summaries and can do analysis with conclusions that deliver on objectives and support proactive insights and recommendations. The role will include writing creative reports for premium brands and looking at data from various sources including survey data and big data sources like social media.
jobs.job_description: For this role, you will need at least a bachelor's degree in marketing research or a related discipline like statistics or maths. And experience with different data sources and reports. Atleast 4 to 7 years of experience with data and analysis.
jobs.job_requirements:
Education & Experience
4-7 years’ experience in working with multiple data set
Self-motivated with high ethical standards, able to work independently and as a team.
Proven ability to meet strict deadlines and maintain timelines and calendars.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.
Capable of thinking outside the box and generating creative ideas.

What Soft Skills Do You Need?

Verbal Communication: Good speaking skills will allow you to present the results of your research to clients and colleagues.
Listening: Strong listening skills are essential to understanding your clients' needs and the scope of the projects on which you are working.
Writing: You must be able to present written reports of your research.
Reading Comprehension: You will have to be able to understand a large number of documents, including research reports and survey responses.
Critical Thinking: As a marketing research analyst, you will have to decide between different strategies to market products. Your ability to compare and contrast different approaches to make an educated decision is essential.
Problem Solving: You must be able to detect problems, and come up with solutions.
Analytical Skills: Your research will yield a lot of data that you must be able to analyze, understand, and from which you must draw conclusions. This part of your job will also require you to be detail oriented.
skills: Working With Different Data Sources Like Survey And Social Media Data

jobs.title: E&I Testing and Commissioning Lead / Supervisor
jobs.job_description:
Develop and execute detailed Testing and Commissioning (T&C) plans and procedures for:
- Low and medium voltage switchgear
- Motor control centers (MCC)
- Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS)
- HVAC systems
- Fire and gas detection systems
- Lighting and small power
- Control and instrumentation interfaces

Oversee pre-commissioning activities, including:
- Inspection and verification of equipment installation
- Continuity and insulation resistance testing
- Functional checks
- Loop checks and interlock testing

Plan and supervise energization sequences in compliance with project safety standards and permit systems.

Liaise with project teams, vendors, and offshore operations personnel to align priorities and resolve technical issues.

Ensure all commissioning records, check sheets, and test reports are properly documented and approved.

Lead troubleshooting and rectification of defects during commissioning and early operation.

Enforce strict adherence to offshore safety procedures, isolations, and PTW requirements.

Provide progress reporting and status updates to project management.

Support training and handover to the client operations team.
jobs.job_requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, Instrumentation, or a related discipline.
Minimum 5–8 years’ experience in Testing & Commissioning of electrical systems in:
- Offshore platforms
- FPSOs
- Oil & gas process facilities

Demonstrated Expertise In:
- Switchgear and MCC commissioning
- Protection relay testing
- UPS and battery systems
- Control system interfaces (DCS/ESD/F&G)

Valid offshore survival certification (e.g., BOSIET)

Familiarity With Relevant Standards:
- IEC 61892 (Offshore Installations)
- API RP 14F
- ATEX / IECEx Electrical area classification and hazardous area practices

Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
Experience working with packaged E-House vendors and FAT coordination.
Exposure to dynamic commissioning and start-up phases of large offshore projects.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.about_us: EndoMaster is a medical device company that is driven to revolutionalize surgery through innovative and user-centric robotic solutions. EndoMaster has created a flexible robotic surgical system that can remove early stage gastrointestinal cancer from patients without the need for surgery and long hospital stays. The company is made up of experienced medical device professionals, engineers and clinicians specializing in flexible endoscopy and robotics.
jobs.job_description:
We are looking to hire a junior to mid-level embedded software engineer who can design and develop software for electrical systems for the next generation of surgical robotic systems. The position will be working in an exciting and fast paced technology startup that values creativity, initiative and passion. This position requires the use of software engineering and robotics knowledge to develop and manufacture innovative medical devices in the field of medical robotics. Our emphasis is on bright mid-career engineers who are interested in working for a fast growing medical robotics company. We would like to continue building our team of innovative, passionate people to make great medical robotic solutions.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Solve software problems through thorough evaluation and troubleshooting.
- Solid knowledge and problem solving skills in C and C++ programming languages
- Experience with Eclipse based development environments
- Knowledge of any Windows based development platforms (e.g. Visual Studio, .Net, WPF, MFC)
- Apply software and electronic engineering knowledge to the design and development of new products as well as product changes and enhancements.
- Generate written reports that can clearly contribute to the Design History File.
- Effectively communicate and work with management and team.
- Work closely with a multidisciplinary team (R&D, Quality Assurance and Regulatory Department).
- Create procedures for implementation and testing of algorithms.
- Participate in software design of medical class devices
- Participate in software implementation for the pilot and later stage production of the device.
- Maintain accurate documentation of concepts, algorithms, programs, and processes.
- Design and oversee firmware for each module and each stage of the system.
- Provide engineering support in the resolution of product complaints and/or safety issues.
- Support company goals and objectives, policies and procedures, Good Manufacturing Practices, and regulations.
jobs.job_requirements:
QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, SKILLS):
- BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field
- At least 5 years professional experience working on software and/or electrical systems.
- Knowledge of Eclipse based development environments like ‘Kinetis’ or ‘Code Composer’
- Proficient in C/C++ for UDP/IP and microcontroller programming e.g ‘ARM’ or ‘Ti’
- Knowledge of real-time operating systems like ‘VxWorks’, ‘QNX’, ‘ThreadX’ or similar
- Prior exposure to UL 2601/IEC60601 and ISO 62304 is a plus

jobs.title: Scientist
jobs.about_us: Synthomer hiring Scientist in Kulai, Johore, Malaysia | LinkedIn
jobs.job_description: Main Accountabilities: a) To bring creativity and innovation to problem solving and idea generation in pursuing novel solutions to the H&P new product innovation program, developing polymers for our markets in line with our strategy on sustainability b) Serve as project leader for research in strategic areas and complex R&D projects; designs and executes investigation plans around complex problems that involves more than one area of specialization; communicate all lab results and project reports to superior; and work closely with Technical Service, Operations Improvement Team, Commercial, Production, Regulatory Affairs and Marketing team meeting timelines and resources constraints. c) Proactively identifies new opportunities for technical/research projects, propose technical projects which will enhance Synthomer business performance, and lead the investigation and evaluation of the feasibility for potential products and process improvements, as well as write patents and develop IP strategies to protect our products and know-how. d) Develop new products/formulation based on customer/market needs provided by SBU with defined projects, actively exploring chances of converting new technologies into commercial products and supporting current product troubleshooting (about 70%, 20% & 10% of working time respectively). e) To be aware and adhere to the overall SHE & quality policies of the company. Expected Deliverable: Creative and novel solutions leading to new products for the H&P market which enhance the company’s business in line with it’s strategy and sustainability targets. Other Responsibilities: f) To identify, report on and improve safety related issues in immediate working environment using available tools and systems. g) Conduct competitors’ patent monitoring in Intellectual Property landscape h) To develop training programs for lab personnel by advising and consulting in the areas of expertise; give technical direction for chemists who are doing work in related projects.
jobs.job_requirements: Minimum Requirements: PhD Degree in emulsion related area with good knowledge of polymer synthesis 5 years’ experience in R&D industrial emulsion polymerization. Ability to demonstrate creative independent research using current best practices, analytical tools and external resources. Publications and patents related to the synthesis of polymer is a plus. Desirable Skill / Knowledge Polymer science, materials science, emulsion polymerisation, chemistry, IT skills Competency Innovative mindset, creativity, out of the box thinking, complex problem solving, curiosity, generates imaginative ideas and solutions.

jobs.title: Production Engineer (Weekend warrior)
jobs.about_us: Jump Trading Group is committed to world class research. We empower exceptional talents in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science to seek scientific boundaries, push through them, and apply cutting edge research to global financial markets. Our culture is unique. Constant innovation requires fearlessness, creativity, intellectual honesty, and a relentless competitive streak. We believe in winning together and unlocking unique individual talent by incenting collaboration and mutual respect. At Jump, research outcomes drive more than superior risk adjusted returns. We design, develop, and deploy technologies that change our world, fund start-ups across industries, and partner with leading global research organizations and universities to solve problems. Our Production Engineering team is based in Chicago, New York, London and Singapore with some members in smaller offices or fully remote. We operate as one global team to support Jump’s infrastructure including multiple world-leading High-Performance Computing (HPC) environments and a diverse global trading infrastructure that operates across many global financial markets. The team is responsible for everything from low level infrastructure to applications, making heavy use of both internally developed and open-source software.
jobs.job_description: As a Production Engineer, you'll have the opportunity to showcase your skills as a deeply technical resource with exceptional troubleshooting skills when required. We are looking for someone who loves learning new cutting-edge technologies and getting their hands dirty to solve challenging technical problems. As a Production Engineering Weekend Warrior, you will be working a modified 4- or 5-day work week that includes Saturday and Sunday to help support our infrastructure on a full-time basis. You will work the equivalent of a third of the weekends in a year (on a schedule agreed with two fellow weekend shift colleagues in your region). During "on" weekends, you will work 12-hour shifts that overlap with colleagues in the other time zone (US & APAC). You'll have two days off during the week, and on workdays, you'll work flexible hours with the rest of the Jump Production Engineering team. Worth noting, other teams have a similar setup, so you will join a virtual ‘weekend warrior’ team online all weekend in your time zone. Also, Jump’s systems are heavily automated so most of your time will be focused on project work – but you will be available for immediate troubleshooting and support as required.
jobs.job_requirements:
What You'll Do
- Work on global projects across a wide range of infrastructure
- Manage and resolve technical issues with a high degree of technical complexity
- Develop tools that will help in diagnosing, resolving, and triaging difficult problems
- Other duties as assigned or required (we pride ourselves on avoiding “siloing”, so this will include widely different engineering projects
- Work a modified work week, which includes the weekends

Skills You'll Need
- An insatiable desire to learn
- Expert Linux knowledge
- Some Networking knowledge and a willingness to learn more
- Scripting competence with either Go or Python (and a willing to learn both)
- Extensive experience profiling and debugging application stacks
- Extensive experience designing, building, and maintaining complicated systems
- Experience with system configuration management tools (Salt, Puppet, Ansible, etc.)
- A compulsion to perform root-cause analysis
- Reliable and predictable availability

jobs.title: Analog IC Design Engineer - PhD - R&D - Singapore
jobs.about_us: This is a superb opportunity for a highly qualified (PhD) candidate with experience in Analog IC Design to join a world leading Singapore based R&D organisation.
jobs.job_description: In this role you will be responsible for Analog & Mixed Signal IC R&D activities in the area of wearable biomedical device development. You will be involved in system-level design, analysis, modeling and simulation as well as circuit level specification, schematic design, simulation, verification and lab evaluation. You will also be tasked with design documentation and presentation.
jobs.job_requirements:
The successful applicant will be PhD qualified (or equivalent) in a relevant Science/Engineering field with strong emphasis on Analog IC design ideally in the biomedical field and with a few years of post graduate work experience. Experience In Some Or All Of The Following Is Required:
- Low noise, low power amplifier design, specific expertise in Analog front-end circuit design for biopotential signal (EEG/ECG/EMG) acquisition will be a big advantage
- deep understanding of noise (1/f, thermal, jitter and phase) and device matching
- Ultra-low-power circuit design techniques
- Data converters: SAR ADCs, delta-sigma ADCs
- System IC development, and multi-disciplinary R&D experience would be an advantage

jobs.title: Research And Development Manager
jobs.about_us: Sto SEA is a subsidiary of Sto SE & Co. KGaA, an international leader in coating products and systems for buildings. Sto SEA operates in over 87 countries and has a turnover in excess of €1.1 billion. We offer a wide range of solutions in façade systems and coatings, acoustic ceilings, decorative interior coatings, concrete restoration, and flooring systems. We provide comprehensive technical support and advisory services to deliver advanced solutions, and are a member of the Singapore Green Building Council (SGBC).
jobs.job_description: This is a full-time on-site role as an R&D Manager located in Masai. The R&D Manager will be responsible for overseeing day-to-day activities related to research and development, project management, team management, and team leadership.
job_requirements: R&D skills, including experience in product development and testing
Ability to conduct research and analyze findings to implement effective strategies
Team management skills, including the ability to lead and motivate a team
Project management skills, including the ability to manage timelines, budgets, and resources
Team leadership skills, including the ability to provide guidance, feedback, and coaching to team members
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with stakeholders and team members effectively
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or related field
Experience in the coatings industry or related field is a plus
Relevant skills and qualifications that would be beneficial include knowledge of Sto's product range, experience in market research, and fluency in other Southeast Asian languages.

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.about_us: At 8x8 Inc. [Nasdaq:EGHT] we put communications at the heart of our business and build technology that allows people to connect anytime, anywhere they are in the world, and on any device. 8x8 CPaaS provides a cloud-based infrastructure and platform to integrate real-time communications capabilities including SMS, chat apps, voice, and video calls into applications, websites, and workflows, using APIs. With 8x8 CPaaS, organizations around the world have successfully unified omnichannel customer communications to optimize their customer experience. Learn more on our company website at www.8x8.com and follow our pages on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.
jobs.job_description: We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer / Technical lead (Java) to join our growing technology team based in Singapore to work on our core Voice platform. This is an exciting opportunity to become a member of the 8x8 CpaaS Engineering team that is involved in the entire life cycle of development. You will be challenged with tasks related to concurrency, performance optimization and real time processing. What will you build? Being part of a global team of software engineers, we are continuously on the lookout for enhancements to our Voice platform. You will be developing state of the art microservices, based on JVM technologies, which interacts not only with other services but also with some industry leading open source software. How will you do it? As a software engineer, you’ll be involved in all aspects of development, from the inception to delivery. Be it a completely new feature or an enhancement to a feature that is already being loved by our customers, you and your team will enjoy finding the best technical solution, practicing agile methodologies. Our Agile Process is continuously improved in order to support our Continuous Delivery mindset and fast evolving business needs. We are firm believers that Quality relies on healthy engineering practices: Well articulated Technical Design; API First; Great Code, Clean code and clean architecture; Extensive and candid Peer Reviews; Qualitative and quantitative test coverage as per the Pyramid of Tests; Excellent Documentation. Your Responsibilities Code your ideas! Test, review, fix, deploy and celebrate; Lead change requests and design discussions, participate in code reviewing and mentoring junior engineers; Conduct necessary research on new technologies, evaluate, prototype and plan improvements to the platform; Write technical specs for new services and conduct training sessions.
jobs.job_requirements: Requirements A computer science degree or equivalent qualifications 6+ years of professional software development experience; Strong background in design and implementation of RESTful APIs, reusable software components and scalable microservices and a good understanding of algorithms and data structures; Expert knowledge and experience coding in Java, object-oriented programming and design patterns. Think Multi-threaded! Knowledge of concurrency models and best practices; Knowledge in asynchronous programming, caching technologies (i.e. Redis), message queues (i.e. RabbitMq, Kafka), Java frameworks like Vertx.io or Akka.io, RDBMS, Docker and Kubernetes; Working knowledge of Linux, Git, SQL and CI tools; Experienced in agile methodologies; Experience working with SIP stack, SIP servers and other VoIP technologies(desired); Fluency in English (both in writing and speaking) and great communication skills.

jobs.title: Senior Penetration Test Engineer
jobs.about_us: About Bitdeer: Bitdeer Group was founded by Mr. Jihan WU, a leader in the cryptocurrency industry, in cooperation with Sequoia Capital, IDG, and other well-known blockchain investment institutions. It’s the world's leading digital assets mining and cloud service platform, leading for a greener and ecological crypto-mining future. Bitdeer has its operations in Singapore, China and the US. Join us to start this exhilarating journey with the other hundreds of blockchain enthusiasts and people who would like to make an impact together with the world's most reliable digital assets mining ecological service provider!
jobs.job_description: What you will be responsible for: Responsible for the security test (WEB/API/APP) before the project goes online, and provide consultancy and solutions to remediate security gaps; Conduct security tests on the company's infrastructure and online business systems, and discover business security risks and vulnerabilities； Use a variety of penetration testing or threat modelling tools including open source and commercial; Develop sophisticated, state-of-the-art attacks with tools and scripts by maintaining a high level of expertise in the latest attack methods against embedded products; Responsible for the company's cloud business security network and help to formulate cloud business security plans； Clearly articulate risk to the business in terms they understand;
jobs.job_requirements: How you will stand out: Degree in Computer Security, Computer Science, or equivalent discipline; At least 3 years’ hands-on penetration testing experience on infrastructure, network, web applications, mobile applications etc.; Familiar with the steps, methods and processes of penetration testing, and proficient in using common penetration testing tools; Experience in secure code reviews is highly desirable; Solid knowledge and experience in using a variety of penetration testing or threat modelling tools including open source and commercial; Proficiency in at least one programming language (C/C++, python, java, Shell, etc.), familiar with mainstream frameworks; Those with experience in reverse analysis are preferred, and those with in-depth research in the field of blockchain security are preferred; Have good communication, coordination, and execution skills, and have the willingness to take the initiative to complete the work;

jobs.title: Clinical Research Specialist (contract)
jobs.about_us: Vivance is dedicated to changing kidney care through innovative solutions and a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
jobs.job_description:
The Clinical Research Specialist will be part of AWAK's Clinical team. She/He will support the team and participate in Clinical and Pre-Clinical planning and execution.
Responsibilities:
• Coordinate and conduct clinical and pre-clinical (animal) research studies and trials
• Design, develop and follow-up on study protocols, investigator’s brochure, statistical analysis plans for regulatory applications (IRB, Ethics committee, etc.)
• Manage inventory, supplies and logistics required for pre-clinical and clinical study activities
• Work closely with central labs for required test and analysis. Consolidate and infer test results for team review
• Perform administrative duties for coordination with trial/study site, CRO and/or other relevant parties
• Perform various literature research as needed and stay up to date with latest updates in nephrology and general healthcare field
• Document study results and ensure compliance to GCP
• Create and edit high quality written content for publications in articles, white papers and journals
• Perform any other activities not mentioned above, on need basis
jobs.job_requirements:
Educational Requirements:
• Diploma/Degree in Life Sciences, Biomedical Science, Biomedical Engineering or Nursing
Skills / Experience:
• Clinical research/trial experience in hospital / pharmaceutical company / medical device company / clinical research organization
• Working experience in peritoneal dialysis and/or hemodialysis would be an advantage
• Nursing background is a plus
• Knowledge of ICH-GCP and local regulatory guidelines
• Energetic, passionate, and proactive attitude
• Effective communication skills
• Ability to work under pressure and ambiguity
• Strong interpersonal and influencing skills for interacting with team, suppliers and other external partners

jobs.title: Research Engineer - FEOL Process Integration
jobs.about_us: GLOBAL FOUNDRIES is the world’s first full-service semiconductor foundry with a truly global footprint. Launched in March 2009, the company has quickly achieved scale as one of the largest foundries in the world, providing a unique combination of advanced technology and manufacturing to more than 250 customers. With operations in Singapore, Germany and the United States, GLOBAL FOUNDRIES is the only foundry that offers the flexibility and security of manufacturing centers spanning three continents. The company’s 300mm fabs and 200mm fabs provide the full range of process technologies from mainstream to the leading edge. This global manufacturing footprint is supported by major facilities for research, development and design enablement located near hubs of semiconductor activity in the United States, Europe and Asia. GLOBAL FOUNDRIES is owned by the Mubadala Development Company.
jobs.job_description: This position is for a Device and/or Integration Engineer to be a part of the GLOBAL FOUNDRIES Technology Research group at the Albany NanoTech Albany, NY. The individual is expected to lead a portion of the technical activities of a multidisciplinary research activity in the pathfinding, platform, or corridor programs, coordinating across departments and companies to complete technology definition and feasibility demonstrations to fulfill Fab8 requirements. The job involves working in the IBM research alliance with engineers from other partner companies. The primary objective of this position is to conduct research and early integration and process flow development of advanced modules to enable 7nm and beyond platform technologies. The selected individual will work closely with the device, TCAD and unit process development teams as well as design teams defining and executing the integration to meet advanced node requirement. In addition to the employee will also transfer technology developed in Albany to GLOBAL FOUNDRIES Fab8 facility in Malta, NY.
jobs.job_requirements:
Required Qualifications
- Technology related Master's degree plus 5 years or doctorate degree plus 3 years of experience in BEOL integration or related unit process field(s).
- International and domestic travel may be required.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications
- An offer of employment with GLOBAL FOUNDRIES is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen, as applicable, and subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Preferred Qualifications
- Must have a hands-on knowledge of MOL and/or FEOL integration and associated Fab processes.
- Demonstrated expertise in research and development of integrating advanced and complex processes and process technologies.
- Understanding of and familiarity with various characterization techniques including ellipsometry, film stress measurement, SIMS, XPS, adhesion testing, nanoindentation, etc.
- In-depth understanding and working knowledge of Statistical Process Control (SPC) and/or Design of Experiments (DOE).
- Ability to work effectively and efficiently with diverse teams, customers, internal and external partners.
- Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
- Excellent interpersonal skills, energetic, and self-starter.
- Demonstrated ability to work well within a globally matrixed team or environment.
- Demonstrated ability to communicate well with all levels of the organization and experience in working with external constituencies.
- Strong organizational skills; demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and able to react to shifting priorities to meet business needs.
- Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments.
- PhD in Physics, Chemistry, Materials Science, or Engineering.
- Experience as MOL module or level owner in advanced CMOS research and/or development.
- Experience and understanding of high volume manufacturing preferred.
- Understanding of FEOL, MOL, and/or BEOL integration is a plus.
- Understanding and knowledge of current MOL integration trends and roadmap is a plus.
- IBM Alliance experience is a plus.

jobs.title: Research Engineer, Agentic AI Evals
jobs.about_us: HUD (YC W25) is developing agentic evals for Computer Use Agents (CUAs) that browse the web. Our CUA Evals framework is the first comprehensive evaluation tool for CUAs. Our Mission: People don't actually know if AI agents are working. To make AI agents work in the real world, we need detailed evals for a huge range of tasks. We're backed by Y Combinator, and work closely with frontier AI labs to provide agent evaluation infrastructure at scale.
jobs.job_description:
We're looking for a research engineer to help build out task configs and environments for evaluation datasets on HUD's CUA evaluation framework.
Responsibilities
- Build out environments for HUD's CUA evaluation datasets, including evals for safety redteaming, general business tasks, long-horizon agentic tasks etc.
- Deliver custom CUA datasets and evaluation pipelines requested by clients
- Contribute to improving the HUD evaluation harness, depending on your interests, skills, and current organizational priorities. (Optional, but highly valued!)
jobs.job_requirements:
Experience
Technical Skills
- Proficiency in Python, Docker, and Linux environments
- React experience for frontend development
- Production-level software development experience preferred
- Strong technical aptitude and demonstrated problem-solving ability

Strong Candidates May Have
- Startup experience in early-stage technology companies with ability to work independently in fast-paced environments
- Strong communication skills for remote collaboration across time zones
- Familiarity with current AI tools and LLM capabilities
- Understanding of safety and alignment considerations in AI systems
- Evidence of rapid learning and adaptability in technical environments (e.g. programming competitions)
- Have hands-on experience with or contributed to LLM evaluation frameworks (EleutherAI, Inspect, or similar)
- Built custom evaluation pipelines or datasets
- Worked with agentic or multimodal AI evaluation systems

We prioritize technical aptitude and learning potential over years of experience. Motivated candidates are encouraged to apply even if they don't meet all criteria.

jobs.title: Head of Research
jobs.about_us: Our is a leading provider of shared security for Bitcoin, enabling the power of the world’s top economic collateral. As a premier ecosystem partner for Bitcoin restaking, they extend BTC restaking support to dApps and infrastructure as Bitcoin Validated Services (BVSes). Founded by serial entrepreneurs from MIT, Stanford, and YC, they are backed by top crypto leaders, including Hack VC, OKX Ventures, and Franklin Templeton.
jobs.job_description: Role Overview This role can flex to be senior, provided you’re capable of executing the work hands-on before building out and managing a team. You’ll join a small, focused team tackling highly technical challenges in a dynamic environment. You'll collaborate regularly with dApp and infrastructure partner protocols, designing secure and incentive-aligned architectures tailored to their crypto-economic security needs. You’ll also identify emerging use cases for Bitcoin-based secure applications (BVS) and share those insights with the broader Web3 community. Key Responsibilities Design crypto-economically sound architectures with partner protocols Research and write blog articles on emerging BVS use cases and core protocol mechanics Investigate new AVS projects and networks to analyze their architecture and cryptographic security assumptions Write technical litepapers covering various protocol aspects such as slashing mechanisms, tokenomics, and more Contribute to academic whitepapers demonstrating the protocol's correctness and reliability
jobs.job_requirements: Key Requirements Master’s degree or equivalent experience in a technical or engineering field Published technical or academic papers in peer-reviewed journals Comprehensive knowledge of various decentralized application architectures, including: L1 consensus mechanisms Optimistic and ZK-rollup settlement models BitVM2 settlement on Bitcoin Slashable safety mechanisms on Babylon Restaking protocols (e.g., Eigenlayer) Familiarity with DeFi protocols such as money markets, interest rate swaps, AMMs, perpetual protocols, etc. Bonus if you can creatively explore how to re-implement these protocols as BVSes
